fields_of_interest: Trade, Competition, Consumers, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Climate Action
eu_initiatives:
Environmental, 
- Programme for the environment and climate action (LIFE) 2021–2027  
safe working environment,  
 - Protection of workers from the risks related to exposure to carcinogens or mutagens at work: limit values and skin notations  
chemical legislation  
 - e.g. post REACH 2018 deadline, incl.waste, plastics.  
social dialog,  
competitiveness 
legislation and initiatives.
organisation_name: The Association of Lithuanian Chemical Industry Enterprises (ALChIE)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
Confederation of Lithuanian Industrialists (CLI) 
European Chemical Industry Council (CEFIC)
goals__remit: Assist members in achieving common goals working with the national and EU institutions. The areas of activities comprise environmental, safe working environment, chemical legislation, social dialog, competitiveness issues.
relevant_communication:
Weekly reviews of the national legislation in power and the projects in the areas - environment, safety, chemical, labor law, energy, e.g. http://www.chemija.lt/a/p/z/v/a/l/g/o/s/ChemTeis.htm 
Taking part in the EU public consultations. 
Transparency mapping tool of the chemical sector in the country e.g. related to EU funding H2020: http://www.chemija.lt/beta/ho/chart1.html 
as well as other areas.
